Posts.Content: ebarb wrote: Today I had my breast biopsy.  It didn't hurt at all and everyone was nice. My microcalc is 3 cm located on the upper outer quadrant at 10:00.  Now I have to go for an MRI on Tuesday (has to be during a certain time in the menstrual cycle) and they expedited my biopsy so instead of hearing Friday I may hear as early as tomorrow or Thursday.  Regardless if it is benign or malignant I have to see a surgeon and have it removed.  I am scared out of my mind.  If I didn't already think the result was going to be cancer, I certainly think it now.  3cm is large!  I read the stages and the size alone would be either stage 2 or stage 3 cancer.  Is there any way that it could be stage 1 or 0 still?  Then it might not be DCIS?  I thought if anything it would be DCIS because of the microcalcs.   Any guidance or words of encouragement?  Now I am thinking it could be worse than I orignally thought.  PS What does it mean when they say the lump is broad, other than the obvious?  IDC, 5/26/2010 Dx 5/26/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 3/16 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Dr.'s words: "I am more concerned than not concerned" ebarb mom3band1g

Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 12:53PM ebarb wrote: Beesie, thank you so much for taking the time to answer my questions and venting.  My approach is to know as much as I can. Thanks, Erin
Posts.Title: worried microcalcs may be breast cancer ebarb vmudrow

Posts.Content: ebarb wrote: I have a cluster of them that are abnormal.  Going for  Stereo core biopsy on Tues. I'm 30 years old and have been going to the gyn since I was 20 FAITHFULLY every 6 months for BE and gyn check ups.  My very first dr. in 2000 told me I was cystic.  I've told every doctor I've had since that I am cystic.  They told me not to worry about anything.  I've told them that my Aunt (mom's sister) had BC and survived over 10 years ago.  They told me not to worry. I found a lump and ran to the dr.  She almost blew me off until I said "feel it when I sit up... it's there" and she sent me for an ultra and a mammo.  The ultra lady said "I see nothing" and the mammo found suspicious clusters.  I am scared out of my mind.  I've always been cautious and went to the dr. more than I went to church.  Why is it they found something now that can't even be seen?  If I didn't feel something and insist that there was a lump she never would have sent me.  PS- I was only at the gyn 5 mos. ago and there was no lump that I could feel. What I felt and what the mammo picked up are 2 different things.  Thank god I insisted.  Do these take a long time to form?  Could this be new or something I've had for years?? IDC, 5/26/2010 Dx 5/26/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 3/16 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: worried microcalcs may be breast cancer ebarb vmudrow

Posts.Content: May 25, 2010 08:15PM ebarb wrote: AMT,  I didn't feel a thing.  The lidocaine hurt at first, but then all the other lido shots weren't felt.  I didn't even know the biopsy needle went in!  I couldn't see anything, my head was facing a wall.  I asked about the mammo fr the biopsyand they said it is the same resolution as the regular machine they used the week before.  It hurts a little now, and it's swollen.  My husband says it's not as bad as I think, though.  I've been icing it often and changing it every 20 min.  They are expediting my biopsy b/c I need an MRI sched. for Tues, so I may hear tomorrow or Thursday.  But before the MRI was mentioned, they thought I'd get results on Friday.  You'll probably hear Wed. of next week, Monday is a holiday and I don't know if labs observe those or not.   They'll tell me ont he phone good or bad, because I asked them to.  It depends on your dr.  Let us know how you do, and I'll do the same!  Best of luck :)
Posts.Title: worried microcalcs may be breast cancer ebarb vmudrow
